Image C only
[Class Image]

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999. More...

Defines

#define k_GetPixel1bp(x, y, Image)   ((((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][(x)>>3])&(0x80>>((x)&0x7)))!=0)
 Macro function for accessing pixels in an image with 1 b/p only.

#define k_GetPixel8bp(x, y, Image)   (((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][(x)])&0xff)
 Macro function for accessing pixels in an image with 8 b/p only.

#define k_GetPixel24bp(x, y, Image)   ((*(UINT32*)(&((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][3*(x)])))&0xffffff)
 Macro function for accessing pixels in an image with 24 b/p only.

#define k_SetPixel1bp(x, y, Color, Image)   (Color ? ((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][(x)>>3] |= (0x80>>((x) & 0x7))) : ((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][(x)>>3] &= (0xff7f>>((x) & 0x7))))
 Macro function for setting pixels in an image with 1 b/p only.

#define k_SetPixel8bp(x, y, Color, Image)   ((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][(x)]=(UINT8)Color);
 Macro function for setting pixels in an image with 8 b/p only.

#define k_SetPixel24bp(x, y, Color, Image)   (*((UINT32*)&((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][3*(x)])) = ((*((UINT32*)&((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][3*(x)]))) & 0xff000000) | (Color & 0x00ffffff));
 Macro function for setting pixels in an image with 24 b/p only.


Functions

UINT32 k_GetPixel (int x, int y, const TImage *pInfo)
 Returns a pixel value at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

UINT32 k_GetPixelFast (int x, int y, const TImage *pInfo)
 Returns a pixel value at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

bool k_SetPixel (int x, int y, UINT32 Color, TImage *pInfo)
 Sets a pixel at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

bool k_SetPixelFast (int x, int y, UINT32 Color, TImage *pInfo)
 Sets a pixel at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

float k_GetPixelInterpolated (float x, float y, const TImage *pInfo)
 For graytone images only, needs 1,4 and 8 b/p, produces an error in other cases.

float k_GetPixelInterpolatedFast (float x, float y, const TImage *pInfo)
 A faster version of k_GetPixelInterpolated(), no range checking and origo must be (0,0).

UINT32 k_GetColorInterpolated (float x, float y, const TImage *pInfo)
 For images with 24 b/p only (error if not 24 b/p), uses bilinar interpolation for each color channel (R, G and B) and rounds of to integer value.

UINT32 k_GetColorInterpolatedFast (float x, float y, const TImage *pInfo)
 A faster version of GetColorInterpolated(), no checking of 24 b/p, no range checking, and origo must be (0,0).

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999.

Basic image functions to be used as stand alone c functions only. The C++ part does not use these functions.

Version:
1.00
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Define Documentation

#define k_GetPixel1bp (  x,
y,
Image    )     ((((Image).ppMatrix[(y)][(x)>>3])&(0x80>>((x)&0x7)))!=0)
 

Macro function for accessing pixels in an image with 1 b/p only.

The macro is very fast, but be carefull when using the macro, there are no type and range checking. Orego always (0,0).

Parameters:
x  (int) x-position
y  (int) y-position
Image  (TImage) The image to access pixel in.

Function Documentation

UINT32 k_GetColorInterpolated (  float    x,
float    y,
const TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

For images with 24 b/p only (error if not 24 b/p), uses bilinar interpolation for each color channel (R, G and B) and rounds of to integer value.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction
y  The position in vertical direction
Returns :
interpolated pixel value

Definition at line 2802 of file kernel_functions.c.

References TImage::Bits, TImage::BorderSize, TImage::Height, k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_GetPixel24bp, k_InitString(), k_PalCreateRGB, k_PalGetBVal, k_PalGetGVal, k_PalGetRVal, k_ShowMessage(), TImage::Origo, UINT32, TImage::Width, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

UINT32 k_GetColorInterpolatedFast (  float    x,
float    y,
const TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

A faster version of GetColorInterpolated(), no checking of 24 b/p, no range checking, and origo must be (0,0).

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction
y  The position in vertical direction
Returns :
interpolated pixel value

UINT32 k_GetPixel (  int    x,
int    y,
const TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Returns a pixel value at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
Returns :
pixel value, for 24 b/p: R+G*256+B*256*256.

float k_GetPixelInterpolated (  float    x,
float    y,
const TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

For graytone images only, needs 1,4 and 8 b/p, produces an error in other cases.

Uses bilinar interpolation.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction
y  The position in vertical direction
Returns :
interpolated pixel value

bool k_SetPixel (  int    x,
int    y,
UINT32    Color,
TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Sets a pixel at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
Color  The new pixel value, for 24 b/p images an RGB value, otherwise a palette index value.
Returns :
false if outside image or if b/p is not supported.
